function.name: runJavascript
function.param: URL of the file to load and run. It must be a local chrome:, resource: or file: URL. If it's a file: URL, make it relative to location of the test suite, and use file://`SeLiteSettings.getTestSuiteFolder()`/relative/path/file.js (as per http://selite.github.io/PackagedScripts).

Scope object. Optional. If present, it must an object passed through SelBlocksGlobal enhanced sytax =<>({ ... })<> (see http://selite.github.io/EnhancedSelenese).
If you'd like sthe script to access 'document' object, use EhancedSelenese and pass =<>({ document: selenium.browserbot.getDocument() })<>.
If scope is not passed, the file is loaded into Selenium Core scope.
function.comment:
This loads and runs a privileged Javascript file. It doesn't cache it. This could load a Core extension, but don't use it for that. It's intended to load Javascript that tests functionality which would be too awkward to test directly from Selenese.
If the file fails, this adds the stack trace to the error's message, so that the stack trace shows up in Selenium IDE log.
This command is a part of SeLite Miscellaneous.
